title: 104_hr2983
content: SECTION 1. RESTORATION OF INVESTMENT CREDIT. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows for a general investment credit of 10 percent of qualified investment for any taxable year. Qualified investment is the aggregate of specific investments made during the year. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows for a general investment credit of 10 percent of qualified investment for any taxable year. Qualified investment is the aggregate of the basis of new section 38 property and the cost of used section 38 property placed in service by the taxpayer during the year. The applicable percentage for each property is determined under specific rules. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows for a general investment credit of 10 percent of qualified investment for any taxable year. Section 38 property includes tangible personal property used in manufacturing, production, or extraction, but excludes buildings and structural components. Subsections (b) and (c) of section 48 apply for this purpose. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows for a general investment credit of 10 percent of qualified investment for any taxable year. Section 38 property includes tangible personal property used in manufacturing, production, or extraction, but excludes buildings and structural components. Subsections (b) and (c) of section 48 apply for this purpose. The provision also covers facilities for transportation, communications, energy, water, sewage, research, and bulk storage of commodities, as well as elevators and escalators constructed by the taxpayer. The term "section 38 property" includes tangible personal property used in manufacturing, production, or extraction, excluding buildings and structural components. It also covers facilities for transportation, communications, energy, water, sewage, research, and bulk storage of commodities, as well as elevators and escalators constructed by the taxpayer. This property must have a useful life of 3 years or more to qualify for depreciation or amortization. Technical amendments are made to section 49(a)(1) of the Code regarding the basis of new section 38 property. Coordination with other credits is required for certain properties unless the taxpayer elects to waive such credits. Rules similar to those in effect before the Revenue Reconciliation Act of 1990 apply for progress expenditure purposes. Technical amendments are made to section 49(a)(1) of the Code regarding the basis of new section 38 property, including special rules for certain 3-year property. Subparagraph (E) of section 50(a)(2) is amended to include reference to section 48(c)(5). The section heading for section 48 of the Code is amended to read as follows: the percentage in clause (iii) of the table is 33 percent, and clauses (iv) and (v) of the table do not apply. The table of sections for subpart E of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Code is amended by replacing the item for section 48 with "Other credits." The effective date for these amendments applies to periods after the enactment of the Act.
